title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
description: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

items.content_html:
The Drupal project uses the third-party library Archive_Tar, which has released a security improvement that is needed to protect some Drupal configurations.

Multiple vulnerabilities are possible if Drupal is configured to allow .tar, .tar.gz, .bz2 or .tlz file uploads and processes them.

The latest versions of Drupal update Archive_Tar to 1.4.9 to mitigate the file processing vulnerabilities.

References

  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/drupal/drupal/2019-12-18-4.yaml
  • https://www.drupal.org/sa-core-2019-012
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-m9fv-whq2-6wmc
items.title: [drupal/drupal] Drupal core Multiple vulnerabilities due to the use of the third-party library Archive_Tar

items.content_html:
The Media Library module has a security vulnerability whereby it doesn't sufficiently restrict access to media items in certain configurations.

Solution:

If you are using Drupal 8.7.x, you should upgrade to Drupal 8.7.11. If you are using Drupal 8.8.x, you should upgrade to Drupal 8.8.1. Versions of Drupal 8 prior to 8.7.x are end-of-life and do not receive security coverage.

Alternatively, you may mitigate this vulnerability by unchecking the "Enable advanced UI" checkbox on /admin/config/media/media-library. (This mitigation is not available in 8.7.x.)

References

  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/drupal/drupal/2019-12-18-3.yaml
  • https://www.drupal.org/sa-core-2019-011
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-5x28-3f32-x523
items.title: [drupal/drupal] Drupal core Access control bypass

items.content_html:
The Media Library module has a security vulnerability whereby it doesn't sufficiently restrict access to media items in certain configurations.

Solution:

If you are using Drupal 8.7.x, you should upgrade to Drupal 8.7.11. If you are using Drupal 8.8.x, you should upgrade to Drupal 8.8.1. Versions of Drupal 8 prior to 8.7.x are end-of-life and do not receive security coverage.

Alternatively, you may mitigate this vulnerability by unchecking the "Enable advanced UI" checkbox on /admin/config/media/media-library. (This mitigation is not available in 8.7.x.)

items.title: [drupal/drupal] Drupal core Access control bypass

items.content_html:
A visit to install.php can cause cached data to become corrupted. This could cause a site to be impaired until caches are rebuilt.

References

  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/drupal/drupal/2019-12-18-1.yaml
  • https://www.drupal.org/sa-core-2019-009
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-w333-5f96-mjrr
items.title: [drupal/drupal] Drupal core Denial of Service

items.title: [drupal/drupal] Drupal core Denial of Service

items.content_html:
In Drupal core, when sending email some variables were not being sanitized for shell arguments in DefaultMailSystem::mail(), which could lead to remote code execution.

References

  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/drupal/drupal/2018-10-17-4.yaml
  • https://www.drupal.org/sa-core-2018-006
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-jf8c-36vw-98x4
items.title: [drupal/drupal] Drupal core Remote Code Execution

items.content_html:

items.content_html:
The Contextual Links module doesn't sufficiently validate the requested contextual links. This vulnerability is mitigated by the fact that an attacker must have a role with the permission "access contextual links".

References

  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/drupal/drupal/2018-10-17-5.yaml
  • https://www.drupal.org/sa-core-2018-006
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-jjx7-8462-w4m4
items.title: [drupal/drupal] Drupal Core Insufficient Contextual Links validation leads to Remote Code Execution

items.content_html:
The Contextual Links module doesn't sufficiently validate the requested contextual links. This vulnerability is mitigated by the fact that an attacker must have a role with the permission "access contextual links".

References

  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/drupal/drupal/2018-10-17-5.yaml
  • https://www.drupal.org/sa-core-2018-006
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-jjx7-8462-w4m4
items.title: [drupal/drupal] Drupal Core Insufficient Contextual Links validation leads to Remote Code Execution

items.content_html:
Drupal 8 core's file_save_upload() function does not strip the leading and trailing dot ('.') from filenames, like Drupal 7 did.

Users with the ability to upload files with any extension in conjunction with contributed modules may be able to use this to upload system files such as .htaccess in order to bypass protections afforded by Drupal's default .htaccess file.

After this fix, file_save_upload() now trims leading and trailing dots from filenames.

References

  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/drupal/drupal/2019-12-18-2.yaml
  • https://www.drupal.org/sa-core-2019-010
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-58xv-7h9r-mx3c
items.title: [drupal/drupal] Drupal Malicious file upload with filenames stating with dot

items.content_html:
Drupal 8 core's file_save_upload() function does not strip the leading and trailing dot ('.') from filenames, like Drupal 7 did.

Users with the ability to upload files with any extension in conjunction with contributed modules may be able to use this to upload system files such as .htaccess in order to bypass protections afforded by Drupal's default .htaccess file.

After this fix, file_save_upload() now trims leading and trailing dots from filenames.

References

  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/drupal/drupal/2019-12-18-2.yaml

items.title: [drupal/drupal] Drupal Malicious file upload with filenames stating with dot

items.content_html:
Drupal core and contributed modules frequently use a "destination" query string parameter in URLs to redirect users to a new destination after completing an action on the current page. Under certain circumstances, malicious users can use this parameter to construct a URL that will trick users into being redirected to a 3rd party website, thereby exposing the users to potential social engineering attacks.

References

  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/drupal/drupal/2018-10-17-3.yaml
  • https://www.drupal.org/sa-core-2018-006
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-x6v2-xmrq-574j
items.title: [drupal/drupal] Drupal Anonymous Open Redirect

items.title: [drupal/drupal] Drupal Anonymous Open Redirect

items.content_html:
In some conditions, drupal content moderation fails to check a users access to use certain transitions, leading to an access bypass.

References

  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/drupal/drupal/2018-10-17-1.yaml
  • https://www.drupal.org/sa-core-2018-006
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-86xw-vmcx-9mj4
items.title: [drupal/drupal] Drupal Content moderation Access bypass

items.content_html:
In some conditions, drupal content moderation fails to check a users access to use certain transitions, leading to an access bypass.

References

  • https://www.drupal.org/sa-core-2018-006

items.title: [drupal/drupal] Drupal Content moderation Access bypass

items.content_html:
The path module in Drupal allows users with the 'administer paths' to create pretty URLs for content. In certain circumstances the user can enter a particular path that triggers an open redirect to a malicious url.

References

  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/drupal/drupal/2018-10-17-2.yaml
  • https://www.drupal.org/sa-core-2018-006
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-r67r-42wx-c8r7
items.title: [drupal/drupal] Drupal External URL injection through URL aliases leading to Open Redirect

items.content_html:
The path module in Drupal allows users with the 'administer paths' to create pretty URLs for content. In certain circumstances the user can enter a particular path that triggers an open redirect to a malicious url.

References

  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/drupal/drupal/2018-10-17-2.yaml
  • https://www.drupal.org/sa-core-2018-006
